Grid¶

A (responsive) grid similiar to Foundation’s one. Offers columns and rows.

The number of cols/rows can be configured via the $columns / $rows variable in blue leaf Core.

Each element in the grid is a box and cannot be a container (see Container).

A group of box es should be wrapped in a container. This container must have a defined width to make the col s work properly. Same is true for row s and the container’s height.

Offsets¶

A col or a row can have an offset.

Source ordering¶

*col*s and *row*s can do source ordering (e.g. push and pull). For example, the code

HTML:

<div class="first">1st</div>
<div class="second">2nd</div>

SASS:

.first {@include col(6);}
.second {@include col(6);}

has the same output as:

HTML:

<div class="second">2nd</div>
<div class="first">1st</div>

SASS:

.second {@include col(6);@include col-push(6);}
.first {@include col(6);@include col-pull(6);}

For more information refer to the grid demo.

Direction¶

Each box has a direction indicating from which side the parent element will be filled (left or right).

SASS¶

@mixin box($direction)

An element which is part of the grid. Will be used by col and row, no need to use this directly.

$direction

left or right, indicates the alignment of the grid.

@mixin col($size,$direction:left)

An element with the width of $size cols.

$size

Width of the element.

$direction

See box.

@mixin col-offset($x)

Offset to the left of $x cols.

$x

Width of the offset.

@mixin col-push($x)

The element pushes itself $x cols to the right.

$x

Number of cols.

@mixin col-pull($x)

The element pulls itself $x cols to the left.

$x

Number of cols.

@mixin row($size,$direction:left)

An element with the height of $size rows.

$size

Height of the element.

$direction

See box.

@mixin row-offset($x)

Offset to the top of $x rows. This mixin uses JavaScript.

$x

Height of the offset.

@mixin row-push($x)

The element pushes itself $x rows to the bottom.

$x

Number of rows.

@mixin row-pull($x)

The element pulls itself $x rows to the top.

$x

Number of rows.
